A Recap of the ConventionTimes political reporters discuss what happened and what’s ahead

Mnuchin Paved Way for Postal Service Shake-UpThe Postal Service was walled off from political influence in 1970. Then Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin got involved at President Trump’s behest.Now the Trump administration is facing allegations it sought to politicize the agency and hinder its ability to handle a surge in mail-in ballots.

BREAKING NEWSHouse Votes to Block Postal Changes and Allocate Funds for MailThe Democratic bill would send $25 billion to the Postal Service and temporarily reverse changes that have slowed service as the election approaches.
George H.W. Bush won the presidency in 1988 by a margin of 53 percent to 46 percent. Mike Sprague/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
For a new generation of leaders, the political uniform includes “the reddest of lips and biggest of hoops.”
2 Blazes Are Among California’s Largest EverSpreading wildfires have torched nearly one million acres in the state, an area larger than Rhode Island. Follow updates here.
An inmate firefighter worked to contain a fire in Colusa County, Calif., this month. Kent Porter/The Press Democrat, via Associated Press

Global Death Toll Surpasses 800,000New infections flared in Europe and high numbers of deaths were recorded across the United States, India, South Africa and most of Latin America.Health officials are linking virus cases to the 10-day Sturgis motorcycle rally, which drew hundreds of thousands of participants. Here’s the latest.
To Slow Virus, Colleges Try to Stop the Partying, but Often FailCoronavirus outbreaks at colleges reopening for fall classes underscore the difficulties of policing student behavior.

A Recap of the ConventionTimes political reporters discuss what happened and what’s ahead

Mnuchin Paved Way for Postal Service Shake-UpThe Postal Service was walled off from political influence in 1970. Then Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin got involved at President Trump’s behest.Now the Trump administration is facing allegations it sought to politicize the agency and hinder its ability to handle a surge in mail-in ballots.
The House approved legislation to block Postal Service changes and grant it $25 billion in aid.
President Trump at the 2020 Council for National Policy Meeting at the Ritz Carlton in Arlington, Va., on Friday. Anna Moneymaker for The New York Times

In Recordings, President’s Sister Calls Him a Liar With ‘No Principles’In a series of recordings published by The Washington Post, Maryanne Trump Barry can be heard disparaging her brother’s performance as president.
2 Blazes Are Among California’s Largest EverFire officials are worried that another extreme period of lightning strikes could potentially bring new blazes to the state.

Covid-19 Limits California’s Efforts to Fight Fires With Prison LaborEarly releases of prisoners to protect them from the virus have depleted the ranks of an inmate firefighting program that some say should be abolished.

Global Death Toll Surpasses 800,000New infections flared in Europe and high numbers of deaths were recorded across the United States, South Africa and most of Latin America.India surpassed a total of three million confirmed cases as a religious festival was allowed to go ahead. Here’s the latest.
Antibody Drug Research Seeks to Protect Nursing Homes From OutbreaksResearchers are testing an experimental drug to halt sudden outbreaks. The trial may bring a new type of treatment for the virus.
Did you feel sick in March? Getting an antibody test won’t tell you much, according to new guidelines.
